# Checklist: Disclosure and Evidence

<!-- This checklist ensures comprehensive approach to disclosure and evidence gathering -->

## Purpose

To systematically identify, obtain, review, and disclose all relevant evidence in contentious probate matters, ensuring CPR compliance.

## When to Use

- During case preparation phase
- Before disclosure deadline
- When preparing witness evidence
- Before instructing experts
- Throughout the litigation process

---

## Section 1: Document Identification

### Documents from Client

- [ ] **Initial documents collected** at intake
- [ ] **Follow-up documents** requested and received
- [ ] **Client advised** of ongoing disclosure obligations

**Documents typically needed:**

**Will and Estate Documents:**
- [ ] Original will and codicils
- [ ] Earlier wills and drafts
- [ ] Letters of wishes
- [ ] Grant of probate/letters of administration
- [ ] Estate accounts
- [ ] Inventory and valuation
- [ ] Correspondence with executor/solicitor

**Deceased's Documents:**
- [ ] Medical records
- [ ] Care home records
- [ ] GP records and notes
- [ ] Hospital records
- [ ] Psychiatric/psychological assessments
- [ ] Capacity assessments

**Financial Records:**
- [ ] Bank statements
- [ ] Investment accounts
- [ ] Property deeds and valuations
- [ ] Tax returns
- [ ] Pension documents
- [ ] Insurance policies

**Correspondence:**
- [ ] Letters between deceased and family
- [ ] Emails
- [ ] Text messages (if relevant)
- [ ] Social media communications

**Other:**
- [ ] Photographs
- [ ] Attendance notes from professionals
- [ ] Diary entries
- [ ] Will file from solicitor
- [ ] Other relevant documents: ___________

### Documents to be Obtained from Third Parties

**From Executor/Opponent:**
- [ ] Will file from preparing solicitor
- [ ] Estate accounts
- [ ] Asset valuations
- [ ] Distribution records
- [ ] Correspondence

**From Medical Providers:**
- [ ] GP medical records - requested: ___________
- [ ] Hospital records - requested: ___________
- [ ] Care home records - requested: ___________
- [ ] Specialist records - requested: ___________
- [ ] Consent obtained from: ___________

**From Financial Institutions:**
- [ ] Bank account records
- [ ] Investment account records
- [ ] Pension records
- [ ] Insurance records

**From Solicitors:**
- [ ] Will file
- [ ] Attendance notes
- [ ] Correspondence
- [ ] Consent/court order obtained: ___________

**Other Third Parties:**
- [ ] Land Registry documents
- [ ] Probate Registry records
- [ ] Court records from other proceedings
- [ ] Other: ___________

---

## Section 2: Document Review and Organization

### Initial Review

- [ ] **All received documents** logged in document register
- [ ] **Chronological order** established
- [ ] **Key documents** identified and flagged
- [ ] **Gaps** in documentation identified
- [ ] **Privileged documents** identified and separated

### Privilege Review

**Legal Advice Privilege:**
- [ ] Client-solicitor communications identified
- [ ] Privileged documents separated
- [ ] Privilege log prepared

**Litigation Privilege:**
- [ ] Documents created for litigation identified
- [ ] Communications with third parties for litigation
- [ ] Expert reports obtained for litigation

**Without Prejudice Privilege:**
- [ ] Settlement communications identified
- [ ] Properly marked as without prejudice
- [ ] Separate from standard disclosure

**Waiver of Privilege:**
- [ ] Any privileged documents to be disclosed?
- [ ] Express waiver documented
- [ ] Implied waiver considered
- [ ] Client consent obtained

### Document Categories

**Favorable Documents:**
- [ ] Identified and indexed
- [ ] To be relied upon at trial
- [ ] Cross-referenced to witness statements

**Unfavorable Documents:**
- [ ] Identified and reviewed
- [ ] Impact on case assessed
- [ ] Strategy for dealing with identified
- [ ] Must still be disclosed if disclosable

**Neutral Documents:**
- [ ] Reviewed for relevance
- [ ] Disclosure obligation considered

---

## Section 3: Standard Disclosure (CPR Part 31)

### Disclosure Obligations

The parties must disclose documents which:

- [ ] **Support their own case**
- [ ] **Adversely affect their own case**
- [ ] **Adversely affect another party's case**
- [ ] **Support another party's case**

**Test:** Documents which a party has or has had control of

### Reasonable Search

**Factors to consider:**
- [ ] Number of documents involved
- [ ] Nature and complexity of proceedings
- [ ] Ease and expense of retrieval
- [ ] Significance of documents likely to be found

**Search locations:**
- [ ] Physical files
- [ ] Electronic files and emails
- [ ] Backup systems
- [ ] Cloud storage
- [ ] Mobile devices
- [ ] Former employees' files
- [ ] Archived materials

**Search terms** (for electronic search):
- [ ] Deceased's name and variations
- [ ] Key parties' names
- [ ] Property addresses
- [ ] Date ranges
- [ ] Specific topics/issues
- [ ] Other relevant terms: ___________

### Disclosure Statement (Form N265)

- [ ] **Disclosure statement** prepared
- [ ] **Extent of search** described
- [ ] **Limitations** on search explained
- [ ] **Signed** by appropriate person (party or legal representative)
- [ ] **Date** of signature

### List of Documents

**Part 1: Documents in party's control**
- [ ] All disclosable documents listed
- [ ] Description of each document
- [ ] Date of document (if known)
- [ ] Clear and consistent numbering

**Part 2: Documents previously disclosed**
- [ ] Documents disclosed with statements of case
- [ ] Documents already provided

**Part 3: Documents not in party's control**
- [ ] Documents had but no longer have
- [ ] When last had control
- [ ] What happened to them

**Part 4: Privileged documents**
- [ ] Documents withheld on grounds of privilege
- [ ] Brief description
- [ ] Grounds for privilege claimed

### Inspection

- [ ] **Documents available** for inspection (non-privileged)
- [ ] **Copies provided** within 7 days of request
- [ ] **Cost of copies** calculated (if chargeable)
- [ ] **Format agreed** (hard copy/electronic)

---

## Section 4: Specific Disclosure

### When to Apply

- [ ] **Standard disclosure inadequate**
- [ ] **Specific documents needed**
- [ ] **Opponent's disclosure insufficient**
- [ ] **Documents known to exist** but not disclosed

### Application

- [ ] **Application notice** drafted
- [ ] **Evidence** in support prepared
- [ ] **Specific documents** clearly identified
- [ ] **Relevance** to issues explained
- [ ] **Proportionality** addressed
- [ ] **Application fee** paid
- [ ] **Served** on opponent

---

## Section 5: Pre-Action Disclosure

### CPR 31.16 Application

**When appropriate:**
- [ ] Before proceedings commenced
- [ ] Disclosure likely to:
  - Dispose fairly of anticipated proceedings
  - Assist dispute resolution without proceedings
  - Save costs

**Application requirements:**
- [ ] **Identify documents** sought
- [ ] **Explain relevance**
- [ ] **State whether proceedings contemplated**
- [ ] **Serve on respondent**

---

## Section 6: Non-Party Disclosure (CPR 31.17)

### When to Apply

- [ ] **Documents held by third party**
- [ ] **Necessary for case**
- [ ] **Proportionate** to obtain

**Common third parties in probate:**
- [ ] Will-drafting solicitor
- [ ] Banks and financial institutions
- [ ] Medical providers
- [ ] Care homes
- [ ] Accountants

### Application

- [ ] **Application notice** prepared
- [ ] **Evidence** explaining need for documents
- [ ] **Third party served** with application
- [ ] **Third party's costs** considered (usually applicant pays)

---

## Section 7: Witness Evidence

### Factual Witnesses

**Identify witnesses:**
- [ ] **Client**
- [ ] **Family members**
- [ ] **Will-drafting solicitor**
- [ ] **Attesting witnesses**
- [ ] **Medical professionals**
- [ ] **Carers**
- [ ] **Friends/associates of deceased**
- [ ] **Other:** ___________

**For each witness:**
- [ ] Contact details obtained
- [ ] Relevance to case identified
- [ ] Likely to be cooperative: [ ] Yes [ ] No
- [ ] Meeting arranged
- [ ] Statement taken
- [ ] Statement approved by witness
- [ ] Statement signed with statement of truth
- [ ] Exhibits prepared and marked

### Witness Statement Requirements

- [ ] **CPR Part 32 compliant**
- [ ] **First person** narrative
- [ ] **Numbered paragraphs**
- [ ] **Facts within knowledge** (or source stated)
- [ ] **Exhibits** properly referenced
- [ ] **Statement of truth**
- [ ] **Signature and date**

See [Witness Statement Skeleton Template](template-witness-statement-skeleton.md)

---

## Section 8: Expert Evidence

### Need for Expert

**Expert required for:**
- [ ] **Testamentary capacity** (medical expert)
- [ ] **Handwriting/signature** (forensic document examiner)
- [ ] **Asset valuation** (property valuer, accountant)
- [ ] **Other:** ___________

### Court Permission

- [ ] **Permission required** (usually)
- [ ] **Application** for permission filed
- [ ] **Expert's field** specified
- [ ] **Issues to be addressed** identified
- [ ] **Permission granted** - Date: ___________

### Instructing Expert

- [ ] **Expert identified** and agreed (if joint expert)
- [ ] **Expert's CV** obtained
- [ ] **Conflicts checked**
- [ ] **Terms of engagement** agreed
- [ ] **Letter of instruction** sent
- [ ] **Documents provided** to expert
- [ ] **Deadline** for report agreed
- [ ] **Fee** agreed

### Letter of Instruction

Must include:
- [ ] Context and background
- [ ] Expert's duties to court (CPR Part 35)
- [ ] Specific questions to be addressed
- [ ] Relevant documents provided
- [ ] Deadline for report
- [ ] Fee and disbursements agreed

### Expert's Report

- [ ] **Report received** by deadline
- [ ] **CPR Part 35 compliant**
  - Expert's qualifications
  - Statement of truth
  - Statement of compliance with duties
  - Range of opinion on matters
  - Summary of conclusions
- [ ] **Report reviewed** with client
- [ ] **Questions** for expert identified
- [ ] **Questions served** within 28 days
- [ ] **Answers received**

### Experts' Discussion

- [ ] **Discussion** ordered/agreed
- [ ] **Agenda** prepared
- [ ] **Joint statement** of areas of agreement/disagreement
- [ ] **Further questions** arising

---

## Section 9: Electronic Evidence

### Emails and Electronic Documents

- [ ] **Email searches** conducted
- [ ] **Relevant emails** identified
- [ ] **Metadata** preserved
- [ ] **Chain of emails** complete
- [ ] **Attachments** included

### Social Media

- [ ] **Relevant platforms** identified
- [ ] **Posts/messages** relevant to case
- [ ] **Screenshots** taken with metadata visible
- [ ] **Authenticity** considered

### Text Messages/WhatsApp

- [ ] **Relevant messages** identified
- [ ] **Screenshots** with context
- [ ] **Date and time** visible
- [ ] **Sender/recipient** clear

### Preservation

- [ ] **Litigation hold** communicated
- [ ] **Electronic evidence** preserved
- [ ] **No deletion** of relevant material
- [ ] **Backup** if necessary

---

## Section 10: Evidence Management

### Document Bundling

- [ ] **Paginated bundle** prepared
- [ ] **Index** with page references
- [ ] **Chronological order** (usually)
- [ ] **Dividers** between sections
- [ ] **Exhibits** clearly marked

See [Bundling and Pagination Guidance](../../admin/contentious-probate-file/bundling-and-pagination-guidance.md)

### Disclosure Bundle

- [ ] All disclosed documents organized
- [ ] Index prepared
- [ ] Page numbers applied
- [ ] Copies for all parties
- [ ] Electronic copies if agreed

### Trial Bundle

- [ ] **Court directions** followed
- [ ] **Agreed documents** only (where possible)
- [ ] **Filed** 7 days before trial (or as directed)
- [ ] **Pagination** agreed
- [ ] **Index** agreed
- [ ] **Sufficient copies** (judge, witnesses, parties)

---

## Section 11: Compliance and Quality

### Disclosure Compliance

- [ ] **Disclosure obligations** met
- [ ] **Continuing duty** understood (must disclose later documents)
- [ ] **Privilege** properly claimed
- [ ] **Disclosure statement** accurate
- [ ] **Deadline** met
- [ ] **Opponent's disclosure** reviewed

### Evidence Quality

- [ ] **All witness statements** reviewed
- [ ] **Consistency** between statements and pleadings
- [ ] **Gaps** identified and addressed
- [ ] **Weaknesses** assessed
- [ ] **Exhibits** complete and properly marked

### Privilege Protection

- [ ] **Privileged documents** not disclosed
- [ ] **Privilege log** maintained
- [ ] **Inadvertent disclosure** procedure known
- [ ] **Privileged documents** clearly marked

---
